tripAdvisorActivities.name: True 4Hour Private Tuk Tuk Tour: Discover Lisbon with a Local!
tripAdvisorActivities.description:
Spend four unforgettable hours exploring the vibrant city of Lisbon from the comfort of a private tuk tuk. Your knowledgeable local guide will whisk you away on a journey through the city's charming streets, revealing the true heart of Lisbon and its rich culture. Discover historic landmarks, picturesque neighborhoods, and hidden gems off the beaten path. Hear fascinating stories behind every corner, savor the cityâ€™s unique atmosphere, and indulge in gastronomic delights at local eateries. This tour will leave you with a deeper understanding of Lisbon's character, history, and local life.

With the flexibility of a private tour, you have the freedom to tailor your itinerary to your interests. Whether you're a history buff, a foodie, or an architecture enthusiast, your guide will ensure a truly personalized experience. Every stop is a new opportunity to immerse yourself in Lisbon's vibrant culture and lifestyle.

The tuk tuk is an eco-friendly and fun way to get around the city. You'll navigate narrow, winding streets with ease and reach breathtaking viewpoints inaccessible by larger vehicles. Experience the authentic side of Lisbon with this unique and intimate tour.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Winner 2025 Undiscovered Lisbon Food & Wine Tour by Eating Europe
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Embark on an unforgettable journey through Lisbon's lesser-known food and wine spots on the Winner 2025 Undiscovered Lisbon Food & Wine Tour by Eating Europe. This tour offers an intimate exploration of Lisbonâ€™s vibrant culinary scene, away from the well-trodden tourist trails. Taste the authentic flavors of Portugal through a variety of tastings, from traditional tapas to delectable desserts and fine local wines. Engage with local chefs, artisans, and wine experts who will share their passion and knowledge about Portuguese cuisine and culture. This tour is not just about food and wine; it's an immersive cultural experience that will leave you with a profound understanding of Lisbonâ€™s culinary heritage.
highlights: Engagement with local food and wine experts

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Private Lisbon Sightseeing Tuk-Tuk Tour: Alfama, Belem & More
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Prepare yourself for an unforgettable adventure through the historic streets of Lisbon on your very own private Tuk-Tuk tour. From the enchanting maze of Alfama's narrow alleys, to the monumental Belem, every stop on this tour is a journey through time. Your experienced guide will entertain and educate you with tales of Lisbon's past and present, bringing the city's vibrant history to life. Customize your tour to visit the sights that interest you most, whether it's the cultural richness of Alfama, or the grandeur of Belem, or both! With a private Tuk-Tuk tour, you have the freedom to create your perfect Lisbon adventure.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Sintra to Cascais: 2 Palaces, 4 Sites, Small Group 10 Hour Tour
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Set off on an epic journey from Lisbon, Portugal, exploring the fascinating cities of Sintra and Cascais. This 10-hour tour immerses you in the culture, history, and picturesque landscapes of these iconic locales. Visit two awe-inspiring palaces and four sites of historical significance, all while being guided by a knowledgeable local. This journey will take you through lush forests, over rugged cliffs, and into the heart of these ancient cities. With a small group size, you'll get a personalized experience, gaining insights into the region's rich heritage and captivating tales. This tour is not just about sightseeing, it's about stepping back in time and immersing yourself in a different world.
highlights: Spectacular views of Cabo da Roca

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Marques Do Pombal
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Prepare to be mesmerized by the grandeur of Marques Do Pombal, one of Lisbon's most iconic landmarks. This regal square, named after the Marquis of Pombal, the city's former Prime Minister, is a hub of history, art, and culture. The impressive monument at its center pays tribute to the Marquis and his efforts to rebuild Lisbon after the devastating 1755 earthquake. Surrounding the monument, the square blooms with intricate designs, statues, and beautiful gardens, offering ample opportunities for photography and relaxation. As you explore, you'll find yourself immersed in Lisbon's historic charm and allure, all while gaining insight into Portugal's fascinating past.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Mosteiro dos Jeronimos
tripAdvisorActivities.description: No expense was spared when they built this masterpiece of Manueline and Gothic architecture in 1502, which was inspired by Vasco da Gama who is buried here with other great navigators of the past.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Hotel Da Baixa
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Located in the heart of the city of lisbon - rua da prata - between praca do comercio and praca do rossio, hotel da baixa gets its name from lisbon's most charismatic neighborhood to give you a unique local experience. This boutique hotel results from a connection between a differentiated service excellence, together with the pombalian architectural elements.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Three Cities in One Day: Porto, Nazare and Obidos from Lisbon
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Immerse yourself in the rich tapestry of Portuguese culture on a full-day tour from Lisbon. Journey through the verdant landscapes of Portugalâ€™s heartland, stopping first at the vibrant city of Porto. Uncover the cityâ€™s rich history, stroll the charming streets, and explore its beautiful monuments. Next, venture to the serene seaside town of NazarÃ©, famed for its golden beaches and monstrous waves. Enjoy a leisurely lunch and soak in the coastal views before heading to the medieval town of Ã“bidos. Wander amidst its ancient walls and narrow cobbled streets, taking in the timeless charm that makes it one of Portugal's most picturesque villages. An adventure that encapsulates the diverse beauty of Portugal, this tour is a feast for the senses.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Devour Lisbon: The Ultimate Portuguese Food Tour
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Embark on an unforgettable gastronomic odyssey through the vibrant streets of Lisbon. The 'Devour Lisbon: The Ultimate Portuguese Food Tour' offers an immersive journey into the heart of this city's rich culinary heritage. Your knowledgeable guide will help unravel the stories behind traditional dishes, famous chefs, and the evolution of Portuguese cuisine. From savoring iconic Pastel de Nata in a local bakery to enjoying a sumptuous seafood feast in a bustling food market, you'll experience the authentic flavors of Portugal's capital city. The tour is more than just a food tasting experience - it's a cultural exploration that takes you through hidden alleyways, charming squares, and historic neighborhoods rich in tradition and local life.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Padrao dos Descobrimentos
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Erected in the honor of Portugal's Prince Henry the Navigator in 1960, this is a dramatic work of art in stone that commemorates Portugal's many famous explorers and adventurers.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Experience Porto's Charm: 3-Hour Guided Walking Tour
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Immerse yourself in the enchanting atmosphere of Porto with our 3-hour guided walking tour. As you stroll through the city's narrow streets and charming squares, you'll uncover a captivating blend of history, culture, and charm. From the grandeur of the historic Ribeira district to the captivating Livraria Lello, one of the world's most beautiful bookstores, every step offers a new discovery. The tour is led by a knowledgeable local guide who will share fascinating insights and stories about Porto's rich heritage. You'll also have the chance to sample the city's famous Port wine, adding a delicious touch to your cultural exploration.
highlights: Insightful stories from a local guide
tripAdvisorActivities.bestTimeToVisit: Spring and fall seasons are ideal for a walking tour, offering pleasant temperatures and fewer crowds.
whatToKnow: Wear comfortable shoes as the tour involves a considerable amount of walking
Bring a water bottle to stay hydrated
Don't forget your camera for stunning photo opportunities

Complete Douro Valley Wine Tour with Lunch, Wine Tastings and River Cruise
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Immerse yourself in the splendor of Portugal's Douro Valley with this comprehensive wine tour. Begin your journey with a visit to two of the region's most prestigious wineries, each offering a unique perspective on Douro's centuries-old winemaking tradition. Here, you'll taste a variety of wines, including the famed Port wine, while learning about the intricate process of their creation. A gourmet lunch at a traditional Portuguese restaurant will tantalize your taste buds with regional delicacies. The second half of your day will see you aboard a river cruise, offering breathtaking views of terraced vineyards and tranquil landscapes. This tour not only indulges the senses but also provides a poignant insight into the rich cultural heritage of Douro Valley.
highlights: Panoramic views of the vineyard landscapes
tripAdvisorActivities.bestTimeToVisit: Spring (April-June) and fall (September-November) are the best seasons to visit, when the weather is pleasant and the vineyards are in full bloom or harvest.

The tour is not recommended for those with dietary restrictions

tripAdvisorActivities.name: The Unvanquished Tour in Porto City Center
Taste Porto Food Tours
tripAdvisorActivities.description:
Experience the authentic flavors of Porto with the Taste Porto Food Tours. This immersive activity takes you through the city's historic streets, introducing you to local eateries, charming markets, and traditional recipes that have been passed down through generations. Your expert guide will regale you with stories, history, and anecdotes about Porto's culinary scene, providing a comprehensive and enjoyable introduction to Portuguese cuisine. From tasting Portoâ€™s famed Francesinha sandwich to sipping on fine Douro Valley wine, this food tour is a must-do for food lovers.

The tour isnâ€™t just about food and wine, itâ€™s also a cultural adventure. As you explore Porto's narrow cobblestone streets, you'll discover the city's architectural gems and historical sites, giving you a taste of the city's rich history and vibrant culture. A Taste Porto Food Tour is more than a meal, it's a feast for all senses.
tripAdvisorActivities.bestTimeToVisit: The Taste Porto Food Tours run year-round, but spring and autumn offer pleasant weather for walking tours.

Come with an empty stomach
Be prepared for any weather - bring an umbrella or hat

photos.caption: Hay construcciones monumentales sin terminar que merecen una visita, y la Sagrada Familia es una de ellas. GaudÃ­ fue el artÃ­fice de este icono de la arquitectura modernista de Barcelona, cuyo interior nos hace sentir como si estuviÃ©ramos bajo las copas de un frondoso bosque â¤ï¸(Photo by Jose Llamas on Unsplash)
BasÃ­lica de la Sagrada Familia | Fachada del Nacimiento
BasÃ­lica de la Sagrada Familia | Fachada de la PasiÃ³n

tripAdvisorActivities.description: The Basilica de la Sagrada Familia, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is an iconic symbol of Barcelona and one of the most visited landmarks in the world. A masterpiece of modernist architecture, it is famed architect Antoni GaudÃ­â€™s most ambitious project. Despite being under construction for over a century, the basilicaâ€™s intricate beauty leaves visitors spellbound. Its towering spires reach for the sky, while the detailed faÃ§ade tells biblical stories. Step inside and be amazed by the kaleidoscope of colors produced by the intricate stained-glass windows. Undeniably, it's a testament to the genius of GaudÃ­'s vision and the dedication of the craftsmen who continue his work. Whether you're an architecture enthusiast or a casual tourist, the Basilica de la Sagrada Familia offers an unforgettable experience.
highlights: Impressive interior with intricate stained-glass windows
Unfinished construction that adds to its charm
Panoramic views of Barcelona from the towers
tripAdvisorActivities.bestTimeToVisit: Early morning or late afternoon to avoid crowds. Mild seasons of Spring and Fall are ideal.

Valencia Old Town Tour with Wine & Tapas in 11th Century Historic Monument
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Embark on an unforgettable journey through Valenciaâ€™s Old Town, a vibrant maze of cobbled streets, lively plazas, and ancient relics. The tour will lead you through centuries, unraveling the cityâ€™s rich history and unique charm. Your knowledgeable guide will share stories of Valenciaâ€™s past, from Roman times to the present. The tour will culminate with a visit to a historic 11th-century monument, where you will be treated to a selection of traditional Spanish tapas and local wine. This experience is not simply a tour, but a journey into the heart of Valenciaâ€™s culture, cuisine, and history.
highlights: Guided tour of Valencia's Old Town
Wine and tapas in a 11th-century monument

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Valencia
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Youâ€™ll find plenty of orange trees here, but the fruit known as the "Valencia orange" was actually developed in California. Travelers interested in local food should focus on paella instead. While the city contains many monuments, Valenciaâ€™s modern crown jewel is the City of Arts and Sciences, a futuristic complex of museums, cinemas, theaters, and more.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: The Westin Valencia
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Tucked away in the heart of Valencia, Spain, The Westin Valencia is a gem that offers unforgettable experiences. The hotel, housed in a 1917 modernist building, seamlessly blends the charm of the past with the comforts of the present. With its lush gardens, magnificent rooms, and exquisite dining options, The Westin Valencia is more than just a place to stay - it's a destination in itself. Whether you're lounging by the pool, enjoying a cocktail at the bar, or exploring the surrounding city, you'll be captivated by the hotel's ambiance and service. The Westin Valencia is a haven of relaxation and luxury, making it a must-visit for those seeking a taste of the high life in Valencia.

photos.caption: Deluxe Twin room Hotel The Westin Valencia
Junior Suite con terraza Hotel The Westin Valencia
Fachada - Exterior Hotel The Westin Valencia

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Parque Natural de la Albufera
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Discover the serene beauty of Parque Natural de la Albufera, a sprawling natural reserve nestled in the heart of Valencia, Spain. This enchanting park, which spans over 21,000 hectares, serves as a sanctuary for a diverse array of flora and fauna. Its centerpiece is a vast, shimmering lake, surrounded by rice fields and lush wetlands. Enjoy a leisurely boat ride across the tranquil waters, or take a stroll along the picturesque trails, soaking in the captivating landscape. As the sun sets, the park transforms into a spectacle of colors, offering breathtaking views. This is not just a visit, but a journey into the heart of nature, a place where you can connect with the earth and recharge your spirits.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Valencia Bike Tour from the City to the Beach
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Embark on an adventurous Valencia Bike Tour that blends urban thrills with seaside tranquility. Commencing from the heart of Valencia, the tour offers an unparalleled exploration of the city's historic neighborhoods and iconic landmarks. Peddle along the Turia Gardens, once a riverbed, now a verdant park showcasing the city's love for nature. The journey climaxes at the mesmerizing beach, where the Mediterranean's azure waters kiss the Spanish coast. Expect an engaging commentary from our local guides, sharing fascinating tales of Valencia's history, culture, and architecture. This tour is the perfect blend of exercise, exploration, and excitement, providing a unique perspective of Valencia.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Valencia Cathedral
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Valencia Cathedral is an attraction located in Valencia, Spain. Whether you're a first-time visitor or a returning traveler, Valencia Cathedral offers something special for everyone. Plan your visit to make the most of your time at this remarkable location.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Mercat Central de Valencia
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Immerse yourself in the authentic Valencian lifestyle with a visit to Mercat Central de Valencia, one of Europe's oldest and largest running food markets. This Art Nouveau masterpiece, with its stunning iron, glass and ceramic dome, houses over 400 independent food stalls teeming with high-quality, fresh produce. Here, you'll discover a feast for all senses as you wander amongst the rich aromas of fresh fruits, vegetables, meats, cheeses, and baked goods. The market is not just a food lover's paradise, but it also serves as a social hub where locals meet, shop, and share the latest gossip. Don't miss the opportunity to try some local delicacies, like horchata and fartons, or to engage with friendly vendors who are always ready to share a story or two about their produce.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: The Fallas
tripAdvisorActivities.description: The vibrant beach city of Valencia celebrates Spring with the incredibly loud and eccentric Fallas Fiesta. For a few days in March giant comical statues as high as the nearby apartment blocks and offices are put up in the streets. These larger-than-life statues, which can cost more than â‚¬100,000 to build, poke fun at celebrities and politicians or make wry political statements about the world in general. On St Josephâ€™s Day the statues are burnt in the streets from about midnight onwards. The Fallas Fiesta also involves ear-shattering firework displays known as 'mascletas,' which can reach decibels of 140 or more, firecrackers, music, bands, parades with women in traditional costumes and hair-pieces (looking very similar to Princess Leiaâ€™s in Star Wars!), fireworks, flower offerings to the Virgin, food, and plenty to drink. The streets are packed with hundreds of thousands of spectators and the incredible noise of the firecrackers makes this a unique way to herald the new season!

photos.caption: Las fallas, la nit del doc en la ciudad de las artes y las ciencias

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Bioparc Valencia
tripAdvisorActivities.description: BIOPARC VALENCIA is a unique zoo. Its design employs the â€œzooimmersionâ€ concept, in which visitors are surrounded by meticulous recreations of the natural habitats being presented. Social animals that live together in groups are displayed, as well as groups of different species that coexist in the same habitats. Predatory species are integrated into the visual space, but are separated from other species by barriers invisible to the eye of the visitor, ensuring the safety of both the animals and the people. The animals, vegetation and landscape provide opportunities for discovering the complexity of natural ecosystems.

photos.caption: El gorila Kabuli en el Ã¡rbol

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Valencia Explorers
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Dive into the heart of the vibrant city of Valencia with Valencia Explorers â€“ a captivating adventure that takes you through the city's iconic landmarks, hidden gems, and culinary delights. Begin your journey in the historic Old Town, where the city's past comes alive through its Gothic architecture and cobblestone streets. Visit the futuristic City of Arts and Sciences, an architectural masterpiece that embodies Valencia's innovation. No journey is complete without indulging in the city's gastronomy. Savor the authentic Paella, a world-renowned Valencian dish, and sip Agua de Valencia, a local cocktail that perfectly captures the city's spirit. With Valencia Explorers, you don't just visit Valencia, you live it.

photos.caption: The parade near the CathedralÂ´s main gate
A boat ride always puts a smile in your face

highlights: City of Arts and Sciences tour
A captivating journey through Valencia's history and culture

description: Immerse yourself in the charm of Valencia, a city where the old meets the new, combining rich history with modern innovation. Wander through the labyrinth of the old town, marveling at the stunning architecture of the Cathedral and the silk exchange, La Lonja. Venture into the futuristic City of Arts and Sciences, an architectural marvel that houses an array of museums, theaters, and the jaw-dropping OceanogrÃ fic, the largest aquarium in Europe. Don't miss the chance to indulge in authentic Paella Valenciana in the city where it was born and sip on refreshing Agua de Valencia. To top it all, enjoy the vibrant nightlife that Valencia has to offer.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: From Split: Krka Waterfalls, Food & Wine Tasting Tour
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Step into Croatia's hidden side with this full-day tour, combining the stunning Krka waterfalls, delicious local food, and an extensive wine tasting. The tour begins with a scenic drive through the beautiful Croatian countryside, leading you to the breathtaking Krka Waterfalls. Here, immerse yourself in the mesmerizing scenery and take a dip in the crystal-clear waters. Then, satiate your taste buds with a sumptuous local lunch, followed by an exclusive wine tasting session at a traditional Dalmatian winery. The tour concludes with a leisurely drive back to Split, leaving you with unforgettable memories and a deeper appreciation of Croatia's natural and culinary treasures.
highlights: Wine Tasting at a Local Winery

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Blue cave, Mamma Mia and Hvar, 5 islands speedboat tour
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Embark on a high-speed chase of adventure and beauty across the Adriatic Sea, where the sparkling turquoise waters meet the warm Croatian sun. Your day begins in Split, where you'll board a speedboat that whisks you away to five stunning islands, each with its own unique charm. First, explore the ethereal Blue Cave, where the water glows with an other-worldly blue light. Then, set foot on the island of Vis, known as the Mamma Mia island, and relive your favorite scenes from the popular musical. From there, head to Hvar, a sun-soaked island known for its vibrant nightlife and stunning beaches. This tour is a delightful mix of breathtaking natural beauty, rich culture, and exhilarating adventure.
highlights: Experiencing the vibrant nightlife of Hvar
Discovering the charm of five unique islands

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Blue Lagoon & 3 Islands Cruise with Lunch from Split
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Set sail from Split and lose yourself in the mesmerizing beauty of Croatia's Dalmatian Coast on a full-day cruise to the Blue Lagoon and three charming islands. The journey starts with a scenic cruise across the turquoise waters, offering breathtaking vistas that are just a teaser of what lies ahead. At the Blue Lagoon, dive into the crystal-clear waters and explore the vibrant marine life or sunbathe on the beach, savoring the tranquility of this hidden paradise. Next, you'll visit the islands of Solta, Brac, and Hvar, each boasting its unique blend of natural beauty, historic charm, and cultural richness. A delicious lunch onboard enhances this unforgettable experience.
highlights: Exploring the islands of Solta, Brac, and Hvar
Stunning views of the Dalmatian Coast
Opportunity to witness native marine life

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Split
tripAdvisorActivities.description: The largest city on the Adriatic Coast, seaside delight Split has been under Roman, Venetian, Austrian, French, Italian and Yugoslav control. There is an abundance of restaurants and wine cellars. Sites such as Diocletian's Palace and Mausoleum, the Grgur Ninski Statue and the Cathedral and Bell Tower of St. Domnius justify its position as a UNESCO-designated World Heritage Site. The city's coves offer several lovely beaches, including central Bacvice. Ferries link Split to Dalmatian summer resorts.

photos.caption: Twist Boat Tour is perfect for thrill seekers. You can enjoy cutting through the waves at high speed as you are submerged into the crystal clear waters of the Adriatic, in the hands of our experienced and talented skipper.  Itâ€™s a semi submarine split boat tour like no other!

Expression 29 is the ideal boat to enjoy the Croatian sun, cruising around near the mediterranean coast. For you holidays, come and spend a great day, either you are with friends or family, you can access great sandy beaches EXPRESSION CHARTER

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Plitvice Lakes National Park Guided Day Tour from Split
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Escape the bustling city of Split and embark on a mesmerizing journey into Croatiaâ€™s natural beauty at the Plitvice Lakes National Park. This guided day tour offers you the chance to explore 16 interconnected, breathtaking turquoise lakes, cascading waterfalls, and lush greenery. Feel the refreshing mist of water on your face as you traverse wooden pathways that crisscross over the crystal-clear waters. Your knowledgeable guide will share fascinating insights about the parkâ€™s flora, fauna, and history. End the day with a relaxing boat ride across Lake Kozjak, soaking up the serene surroundings as you reflect on a day of wondrous exploration.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Sail Croatia
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Sail Croatia is the leading small-ship cruise operator in Croatia, specialising in cruises around the stunning Adriatic coast. Offering luxury small ship cruising, active cruises, party cruises, and yacht experiences, Sail Croatia provides an unparalleled cruising experience that suits all travel styles and budgets.

photos.caption: Elegance Cruise ships, Queen Jelena and Olimp, anchored in a hidden bay for a swim-stop.

Queen Jelena boats regal qualities and for good reason as it boasts the highest levels of comfort onboard. With modern comforts and traditional designs, Queen Jelena is no ordinary cruising experience.
Explore Croatia on an Elegance Cruise designed for mature travellers
Guests jumping off the back of Tempera on their Explorer Cruise
One of our Elegance Cruise chefs serving lunch

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Hvar, Brac & Pakleni islands cruise with lunch & drinks from Split & Trogir
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Escape the hustle and bustle of city life and set sail on a rejuvenating journey to the mesmerizing islands of Hvar, Brac, and Pakleni. Your adventure begins from the historic cities of Split or Trogir, where you'll board a comfortable boat and set course for the serene waters of the Adriatic Sea. As you cruise, enjoy the warm sunshine and cool sea breezes, and marvel at the stunning panorama of the Dalmatian coast. Your first stop is the sun-drenched island of Hvar, known for its lavender fields and vibrant nightlife. Next, explore the unspoiled beauty of Brac, famous for its white-pebble beach, Zlatni Rat. Lastly, discover the hidden coves and azure lagoons of the Pakleni Islands. Throughout the day, enjoy a delicious lunch with a selection of refreshing drinks onboard.
highlights: Cruise around the stunning Adriatic Sea.
Discover the charming islands of Hvar, Brac & Pakleni.
Enjoy a tasty lunch and drinks onboard.
Take a dip in the crystal-clear waters.
Experience the vibrant lifestyle and natural beauty of Croatia's islands.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Split History and Gastro Small-Group Tour with Food and Drinks
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Venture deep into the heart of Split, Croatia on this intimate, small-group tour that combines the city's rich history with its equally rich gastronomic scene. You'll walk the cobbled streets of the UNESCO-listed old town, soak in the ambiance of the vibrant squares and learn about the city's fascinating past from your knowledgeable guide. While history feeds your mind, the gastro part of the tour will satisfy your palate. You'll stop at local markets, bustling bakeries, and hidden taverns where you'll sample traditional Croatian cuisine, savor local wines, and mix with the locals. This tour is a delightful blend of culture, history, and gastronomy that offers a full sensory experience of Split.
highlights: Visits to local markets and taverns

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Marjan Park
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Often referred to as the â€œlungs of the cityâ€, this green forest oasis west of Split's old town area is a favorite amongst locals for hiking, biking, swimming, and rock climbing. The serene walk up to Telegrin peak includes 314 steps and rewards you with stunning panoramic views of the city and the Adriatic Sea. Remember to wear comfortable walking shoes, if not, there's always the tourist train that can take you straight to the top. Take your time to explore the other cool trailsâ€”pitstops include an old Jewish cemetery, quaint churches, cave dwellings, a museum dedicated to local sculptor Ivan Mestrovic, and some of Split's best beaches. â€“ Tripadvisor

photos.caption: Bene, Parc Suma Marjan, Split, Croatie

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Lola Split
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Our menu is based on the principles of using the high quality raw local ingredients, along with the best of ingredients imported from around the world, freshly cooked and presented by our chefs with care and attention. Taste the Mediterranean and be amazed.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Dubrovnik City Walls
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Constructed over a 500-year period mainly during the 12th and 17th centuries, the Dubrovnik City Walls are amongst the most extensive and well-preserved fortifications in Europe. Stretching over 6000 feet, the uninterrupted course offers fantastic views of the coastal city. You can purchase tickets from any City Wall entrance or from official web site dpds@dpds.hr.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Blue Cave Small-Group Boat Tour from Dubrovnik
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Embark on a thrilling small-group boat tour from the enchanting city of Dubrovnik to the mesmerizing Blue Cave. The journey across the Adriatic Sea will captivate you with its turquoise waters and the panoramic vistas of the Croatian coastline. The Blue Cave, renowned for its iridescent blue light, is a natural wonder that will leave you in awe. Within the cave, the sun's rays reflect off the white seabed, creating a magical blue aura. Post the surreal cave experience, enjoy a leisurely swim or snorkel in the crystal-clear waters of a secluded bay. The tour, a perfect blend of adventure and relaxation, is an unforgettable way to experience Croatia's natural beauty.

photos.caption: This is Lopud, you stop here for about an hour.

highlights: Boat ride across the Adriatic Sea
Visit to the radiant Blue Cave
Swimming and snorkeling in a secluded bay
Breathtaking views of the Dubrovnik coastline
Personalized experience in a small group

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Dubrovnik Discovery Old Town Walking Tour
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Take a step back in time as you explore the historic heart of Dubrovnik, Croatia with our Dubrovnik Discovery Old Town Walking Tour. This enchanting journey takes you through narrow cobblestone streets, past diverse architectural marvels and into the fascinating stories of this UNESCO World Heritage site. As you wander along, youâ€™ll be led by an expert guide who will share intriguing tales and facts about the city's rich history, culture, and architecture. From the imposing Onofrio Fountain to the grandeur of the Rector's Palace, every corner reveals a new piece of Dubrovnik's storied past. This tour isn't just about sightseeing; it's about immersing yourself in the soul of Dubrovnik, a city where history and culture are as vibrant as the Adriatic Sea it overlooks.
highlights: Immerse in rich history and culture

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Full-Day Dubrovnik Elaphite Islands Cruise with Lunch and Drinks
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Set sail from Dubrovnik on a full-day cruise to the stunning Elaphite Islands. This archipelago of 13 islands offers untouched natural beauty, rich history, and charming local culture. Your first destination is KoloÄep Island, famous for its dense pine forests and tranquil blue bays. Next, sail towards Lopud Island, where you can relax on the pristine sandy beach or explore the 15th-century Franciscan Monastery. The final stop is the largest island, Å ipan, where you can immerse yourself in the local lifestyle and taste the island's renowned wine. Throughout the journey, enjoy a scrumptious lunch complemented by a selection of local drinks.
highlights: Sailing on the azure Adriatic Sea
Exploring the unspoiled nature of KoloÄep Island
Relaxing on Lopud Island's sandy beach
Visiting historical sites on Å ipan Island
Enjoying a delicious lunch with local drinks

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Rixos Premium Dubrovnik
tripAdvisorActivities.description: A landmark of exceptional beauty, the waterfront Rixos Premium Dubrovnik has been reborn as the ultimate contemporary design hotel with luxurious facilities for discerning travellers. Home to 310 guest rooms that combine panoramic views of the Adriatic Sea with pampering facilities that indulge and inspire, it is conveniently located only 15 minutes away on foot from Dubrovnik Old Town and 25 minutes away by car from the Dubrovnik International airport.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Zipline Experience in Dubrovnik
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Embark on a heart-pounding journey as you zipline through the stunning scenery of Dubrovnik, Croatia. This thrilling adventure allows you to witness the pristine beauty of Croatia from a unique vantage point. Feel the rush of adrenaline as you glide over lush valleys, rugged cliffs, and sparkling waters. Each zipline, carefully designed for maximum excitement and safety, offers an unforgettable experience. Whether you're a seasoned adrenaline junkie or trying it out for the first time, this zipline experience promises the perfect blend of thrill and awe-inspiring views. The professional, friendly guides will ensure you're comfortable and confident before you take off, making it a perfect activity for everyone.
highlights: Thrill of soaring over incredible landscapes

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Dubrovnik: Elaphiti Islands Full-Day Cruise with Lunch
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Set sail from the beautiful city of Dubrovnik and embark on an unforgettable journey to the Elaphiti Islands. This full-day cruise will take you through the azure waters of the Adriatic Sea, offering breathtaking views of the Croatian coastline. The Elaphiti Islands, a small archipelago of thirteen islands, are known for their lush vegetation, clear waters, and white sandy beaches. You'll have ample time to explore the unspoiled beauty of these islands, swim in the crystal-clear waters, and enjoy a delicious lunch onboard. The scenic trip back to Dubrovnik will be just as memorable, as you watch the sunset over the Croatian mainland. Whether you're a nature lover, history buff, or simply looking for a relaxing day out, this cruise has something for everyone.
highlights: Breathtaking views of the Adriatic Sea

tripAdvisorActivities.name: E-Tuk Tuk Tour in Dubrovnik
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Embark on an unforgettable journey through the captivating cityscape of Dubrovnik with the E-Tuk Tuk Tour. This electric-powered, eco-friendly mode of transportation provides a novel and engaging way to explore the city's treasures. Your knowledgeable guide will whisk you around scenic routes, sharing fascinating stories and facts about Dubrovnik's rich heritage. Witness the city's impressive fortresses, charming streets, and picturesque squares, all from the comfort of your Tuk Tuk. This tour offers an intimate and personalized experience, with ample opportunities to capture stunning photos, immerse yourself in local culture, and create lasting memories.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Dubrovnik
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Dubrovnik has recovered from the war damage it suffered during the 1990s, and visitors have returned to this tranquil city. Nestled between the Adriatic and the Dinaric Alps, itâ€™s an accessible and affordable city break for many European travelers. The pedestrian-only Old Town is especially charming.

photos.caption: Book Panorama tour with us , let us take you where the best view is ...

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Dubrovnik: Sea Kayaking & Snorkeling Tour
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Discover a new perspective of Dubrovnik, also known as the 'Pearl of the Adriatic'. This thrilling sea kayaking and snorkeling tour offers an unparalleled way to explore the city's stunning coastline and experience its rich marine life. Paddle along the ancient city walls, navigate through hidden caves, and snorkel in the crystal-clear waters. The tour is led by expert guides who ensure your journey is safe, informative, and fun. Whether you're a seasoned adventurer or a first-time kayaker, this tour is a must-do for everyone visiting Dubrovnik.
highlights: Paddle along Dubrovnik's ancient city walls

highlights.notesHint: Can get very hot in July/August.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Athens Full Day Private Tour
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Embark on an unforgettable journey through history with the Athens Full Day Private Tour. This comprehensive tour lets you explore the cityâ€™s ancient wonders, vibrant neighborhoods, and stunning viewpoints. Guided by an expert, you'll be swept away by the stories of Greek gods, ancient philosophers, and the birth of democracy. Wander through the narrow lanes of Plaka, the old town of Athens, and soak in the vibrant local culture. Marvel at the iconic Acropolis, standing tall as a testament to the grandeur of ancient Greece. Discover the city's modern side at the vibrant Syntagma Square and step into another era at the imposing Panathenaic Stadium. This full-day tour offers a fascinating mix of history, culture, and local flavor, making it an absolute must for any Athens visit.
tripAdvisorActivities.bestTimeToVisit: Spring and Autumn offers milder weather, ideal for outdoor exploration.

tripAdvisorActivities.description: The Acropolis, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is a testament to the grandeur of ancient Greece. Perched high above the city of Athens, this ancient citadel houses the remains of historically significant architectural structures, including the Parthenon, Erechtheion, Propylaea, and the Temple of Athena Nike. As you traverse the historical pathways, you'll be captivated by the blend of natural beauty, archaeological artistry, and historical significance. From the hilltop, you'll enjoy panoramic views of Athens, making this a must-visit spot for photographers. As the sun sets, watch as the cityscape transforms, illuminating the ruins and adding a magical touch to your experience.
highlights: Visiting the Temple of Athena Nike
tripAdvisorActivities.bestTimeToVisit: Early morning or late afternoon to avoid crowds and heat. Spring and Fall seasons offer the most pleasant climate.

tripAdvisorActivities.description: Set sail on an unforgettable journey across the sparkling waters of the Aegean Sea on our Sailing Athens experience. Surrounded by the azure Aegean, you'll be mesmerized by the stunning panoramic views of Athens and its ancient ruins. Our experienced crew will guide you, ensuring a safe and enjoyable sailing experience. Whether you're an experienced sailor or a first-timer, this adventure is designed to thrill and inspire. As the sun sets, watch the sky turn into a canvas of colors, an awe-inspiring sight that will be the highlight of your trip.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: All Day Cruise -3 Islands to Agistri,Moni, Aegina with lunch and drinks included

description:
Step into the magnificent world of Athens, where history and modernity intertwine in a breathtaking dance. Here, ancient ruins stand tall amidst contemporary architecture, narrating tales of civilization's cradle. Embark on a journey through time, starting from the iconic Acropolis, where the Parthenon, a symbol of democracy, proudly presides. Wander through Plaka, the city's old town, with its labyrinthine streets lined with neoclassical architecture, vibrant cafes, and quaint shops. Finally, immerse yourself in the city's pulsating nightlife, epitomized in Psirri's lively tavernas and hip bars.

As the sun sets, Athens takes on a magical allure, with the Parthenon bathed in a soft, golden glow, and the city's vibrant nightlife coming alive. Athens' rich history, delicious cuisine, vibrant culture, and friendly people create a travel experience that is as diverse as it is unforgettable.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Budapest
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Over 15 million gallons of water bubble daily into Budapest's 118 springs and boreholes. The city of spas offers an astounding array of baths, from the sparkling Gellert Baths to the vast 1913 neo-baroque Szechenyi Spa to Rudas Spa, a dramatic 16th-century Turkish pool with original Ottoman architecture. The "Queen of the Danube" is also steeped in history, culture and natural beauty. Get your camera ready for the Roman ruins of the Aquincum Museum, Heroes' Square and Statue Park, and the 300-foot dome of St. Stephen's Basilica.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Budapest City Landmarks Walking Tour in 2 Hours
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Embark on a 2-hour journey through the enchanting streets of Budapest, the heart of Hungary. Our walking tour will take you through a city that seamlessly blends history with modernity. Starting off at the historic Buda Castle, you'll get to marvel at the breathtaking panorama of the Danube flanked by the iconic Hungarian Parliament Building. From there, walk along the charming cobblestone streets to the impressive St. Stephen's Basilica, a masterpiece of neoclassical architecture. The tour concludes at the Heroes' Square, a must-visit landmark commemorating the founding fathers of Hungary. Each step you take is a step back in time, bringing to life the tales of the city's past. This guided tour is a perfect introduction to Budapest's rich history, vibrant culture, and stunning architectural landscape.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Budapest TukTuk
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Discover the world on our three-wheeled convertible! Following your interests, mood and pace, your guide is helping you to create the memorable experience you're looking for. Whether you've already chosen places to visit, want some suggestions or a customised tour, your guide will be happy to drive you around and help you discover the beauty and pleasures of the life in Budapest. You can just sit back and relax, we take care of the rest!

photos.caption: Get to the best places, follow our local insight!
Celebrate your freedom on the top of the city!
Stop by the emblematic landmarks and learn interesting facts%
Explore the city with your friends and travel buddies!

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Corinthia Budapest
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Standing proudly at the heart of grand Budapest, Corinthia occupies a legendary space in Budapest hospitality. Inside walls which have been standing since the late 1800s lies an elegant homage to modern luxury, with a respectful nod to the past round every corner. It is your ideal base from which to explore, with landmarks like Heroesâ€™ Square, Buda Castle and the thermal waters of SzÃ©chenyi Baths within easy reach. A warm Corinthia welcome awaits after a day of exploring; sink into the Royal Spa, an art deco masterpiece where modern comforts sit alongside original features, before discovering an unrivalled collection of restaurants and bars including Caviar & Bull, Uncensored and Rickshaw. Thatâ€™s if you can bear to leave your room of courseâ€¦ each of our accommodations is equipped with every luxury for an unforgettable stay.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: House of Terror Museum
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Located in the heart of Budapest, the House of Terror Museum is a haunting yet fascinating journey through Hungary's harrowing past. The museum, housed in a building that once served as the headquarters for the Nazi and Soviet secret police, presents a chilling tribute to the victims of these brutal regimes. As you navigate the meticulously arranged exhibits, you'll delve into the gripping narrative of war, occupation, and revolution that has shaped Hungary's history. The museum's stark exterior, marked by an ominous steel awning bearing the word 'TERROR', is a stark contrast to the lively cityscape of Budapest. Inside, the eerie atmosphere is complemented by immersive exhibits that employ an array of media, from photographs and personal testimonies to chilling soundscapes. A visit to the House of Terror Museum is an emotionally charged experience, but one that offers a profound insight into Hungary's turbulent past.
highlights: Historic building with a haunting past
Moving tributes to victims of brutality

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Hotel Clark Budapest
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Nestled at the foot of Buda Castle, Hotel Clark offers an unbeatable location with breathtaking views of the Danube and Chain Bridge. This five star, adults-only boutique hotel combines contemporary design with warm Hungarian hospitality, making it perfect for romantic getaways or sophisticated business trips. Guests enjoy luxurious rooms, a rooftop bar with panoramic views, and easy access to Budapest's top attractions, including Fishermanâ€™s Bastion and St. Stephen's Basilica. Indulge in the rich culinary offerings at the hotelâ€™s renowned restaurant or relax in style with exclusive services. Discover the perfect blend of comfort, style, and unforgettable experiences at Hotel Clark.

Lobby with fireplace at Hotel Clark Budapest
Leo Rooftop Bar on the 8th floor of the Hotel Clark Budapest

tripAdvisorActivities.description: Hotel Moments Budapest is located on the stunning World Heritage site of AndrÃ¡ssy Avenue, only a few steps away from the Hungarian State Opera House, the St. Stephen's Basilica and several other spectacular sights of Budapest. Visit our beautifully renewed four-star hotel with 99 elegant and tastefully decorated rooms in three different categories. Let us make your stay with us enjoyable and memorable. We truly hope that you will always remember the pleasant moments.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Prestige Hotel Budapest
tripAdvisorActivities.description: The Prestige Hotel Budapest offers a blend of Hungarian hospitality in an atmosphere of timeless elegance. Magnificent architecture with breathtaking design and divine cuisine. A marriage of these two has Budapest's first Michelin-starred restaurant joined forces with a glorious hotel, set in a restored town palace.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Vaci Street
tripAdvisorActivities.description: The main thoroughfare of Pest during the 18th century, today the pedestrian walkway is lined with upscale shops, restaurants and cafes.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Transfer Budapest Hungary
tripAdvisorActivities.description: TransferBudapestHungary.com - We provide affordable long-distance private transfers to all Hungary and European cities. Included within our long-distance taxi services are most of the major tourist destinations within Hungary and Central-Eastern Europe. If you don't want to be tied down to train or bus that complicate your journey, this is the perfect option for you. Please note about we do not have short-distance taxi service in Budapest (like airport taxi) or shared transportation (sharing the vehicle with other passengers).

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Shooting Range Prague - RANGER Prague
tripAdvisorActivities.description: In the heart of Prague's vibrant landscape lies a unique attraction - the RANGER Prague Shooting Range. This adrenaline-packed destination offers a thrilling escape from the city's historical landmarks and bustling streets. Whether you're a seasoned shooter or a novice, RANGER Prague's experienced instructors will guide you through a safe and unforgettable experience. Armed with your choice of weapons, you'll feel the thrill of every shot as you aim for the target under the watchful eye of professional trainers. The state-of-the-art facilities and wide selection of firearms, from handguns to rifles, ensure an experience that's as educational as it is exhilarating.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Prague Communism History and Nuclear Bunker Tour
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Step back in time and discover the chilling era of Communism in Prague through this insightful tour. Learn about the intriguing history of the Communist regime, its rise and fall, and its impact on the city and its people. Your guide, a knowledgeable local, will share anecdotes, facts, and personal stories that bring the era to life. The second part of the tour takes you underground to a real Cold War nuclear bunker. Immerse yourself in the Cold War atmosphere as you explore this fascinating bunker, filled with gas masks, military equipment, and Cold War relics. This tour is a must for history buffs and those looking to understand Prague's complex past.
highlights: Visit to a genuine Cold War nuclear bunker

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Prague
tripAdvisorActivities.description: The bohemian allure and fairytale features of Prague make it a perfect destination for beach-weary vacationers who want to immerse themselves in culture. You could devote an entire day to exploring Prazsky hrad (Prague Castle), then refueling over a hearty dinner at a classic Czech tavern. Spend some time wandering the Old Town Square before heading over to gape at The Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock. Pragueâ€™s best bars are found in cellars, where historic pubs set the scene for a night of traditional tippling.

photos.caption: Just a little bit of romance...

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Prague Underground Tours
tripAdvisorActivities.description: The Czech Republic is famous for its beautifull architecture. But there are not only the treasures which are visible on first sight on the streets. Beneath the town is an other city. The one from before.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: BoHo Prague Hotel
tripAdvisorActivities.description: A symbol of excellent and unique venue in The Golden City where Culture, Elegance, Wellbeing and Hospitality define our Commitment. Located just steps from the Old Town Square, BoHo hotel provides guests with an ideal opportunity to enjoy or discover Prague. BoHo redefines comfort, elegance and charm in the Golden City of a thousand Spires.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Hilton Prague
tripAdvisorActivities.description: The newly renovated Hilton Prague is truly The Place for Big Imaginations. Located within walking distance to the city centre full of local attractions, shops and a lively night scene and just a 25 minute drive away from the airport. Hilton Prague houses 3 restaurants and 2 bars including the Cafe & Bistro, Seasons restaurant for fine dining, award-winning Cloud 9 Sky Bar & Lounge with two terraces, Hop House and Room Service. Every morning you can enjoy a rich buffet breakfast at Atrium restaurant. All 791 renovated rooms provide high-speed internet access (fee applies). A state-of-the-art fitness centre with cardiovascular machines and a spa with indoor pool are at your disposal. Massages are available as well. This hotel offers 38 multi-functional meeting rooms, the elegant and stylish Ballroom and the spacious Congress Hall.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Prague 3-hour Afternoon Walking Tour including Prague Castle
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Embark on a captivating journey through the heart of Prague, a city steeped in history and architectural splendor. On this 3-hour walking tour, you'll explore the winding streets and iconic squares of Prague's Old Town before ascending to the magnificent Prague Castle. Along the way, your expert guide will share stories of the city's past, from the medieval times to the modern era, revealing the secrets hidden in plain sight. As you walk, you'll be captivated by the city's blend of Gothic, Renaissance, and Baroque architecture, a testament to its storied history. Ending at the Prague Castle, you'll be awestruck by its imposing presence and regal beauty, a fitting finale to your exploration of this enchanting city.
highlights: Walking tour of Prague's Old Town
Learn about the city's history from an expert guide
Explore a mix of Gothic, Renaissance, and Baroque architecture
Enjoy panoramic views of the city

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Prague Castle
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Dive into the fascinating world of Prague Castle, an iconic symbol of the Czech Republic's rich history and cultural heritage. This sprawling complex, perched atop a hill overlooking the city, is a breathtaking amalgamation of architectural styles, ranging from Gothic to Renaissance. As you traverse the castle grounds, you'll be captivated by the grandeur of St. Vitus Cathedral, the charm of the Royal Garden, and the intricate details of the Old Royal Palace. Each corner of the castle tells a different chapter of Prague's past, offering a captivating journey that will leave you in awe. The panoramic views of Prague from the castle's vantage point add an extra layer of enchantment to this unforgettable experience.

photos.caption: History buffs may want to allow an entire day to take everything in at the Prague Castle complex.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Prague Guided Walking Tour and Cruise with Authentic Czech Lunch
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Delve deep into the heart of Prague, one of Europe's most captivating cities, with our Prague Guided Walking Tour and Cruise. Start your day off with a guided walk through the city's historic streets, where you'll marvel at the stunning architecture, vibrant culture, and fascinating history. Your local guide is brimming with knowledge, ready to share the city's many tales and secrets with you. After exploring on foot, take a serene cruise on the beautiful Vltava River, providing you with a unique perspective of the city. Finally, satiate your appetite with a delectable, authentic Czech lunch at a popular local restaurant. This tour is your perfect blend of sightseeing, storytelling, and gastronomy.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Third Reich Berlin: Hitler and WWII Walking Tour
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Discover Berlin's dark past on the Third Reich Berlin: Hitler and WWII Walking Tour. This walking tour immerses you in the city's history during World War II, exploring the rise and fall of Hitler and the Third Reich. As you walk through the city's streets, your expert guide will share stories and facts about the Nazi regime, giving insights into the events that shaped the world. Visit historical sites and see the remnants of this tumultuous time. This tour isn't just a history lesson; it's a powerful reminder of Berlin's past and its impacts on the present day. The tour is a stirring experience, a deep dive into one of the most significant eras of human history.
highlights: Insight into Hitler's rise and fall
tripAdvisorActivities.bestTimeToVisit: The tour operates year-round. However, spring and fall are ideal for a comfortable walk.

This tour involves a moderate amount of walking

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Explore Berlin: See All The Iconic Sights & Some Hidden Gems
Berlinâ€™s Best: Third Reich & Cold War 2 Hour Walking Tour
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Experience history come alive in this 2-hour walking tour of Berlin, a city that has been the epicenter of some of the 20th century's most significant events. Your expert guide will lead you through the city's famous landmarks, unraveling stories of the Third Reich and Cold War era. Walk by the iconic Brandenburg Gate, a quintessential symbol of Berlin, and see the Reichstag, where the German Parliament sits. Discover Checkpoint Charlie, which was the best-known Berlin Wall crossing point during the Cold War, and hear stories of the East-West divide. This tour is not just about historical facts; it's an engaging narrative that will give you a deeper understanding of Berlin's turbulent past and its impact on the present.
tripAdvisorActivities.bestTimeToVisit: This outdoor tour is best experienced between April and October when the weather is generally pleasant.
whatToKnow: Comfortable shoes are a must as the tour involves a lot of walking.
The tour is conducted in English.
It's a good idea to bring a bottle of water.
Don't forget your camera for stunning photo ops.

exclusions: Hotel pick up and drop off

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Berlin Center Food Tour with 8+ Authentic Local Tastings
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Prepare your taste buds for an unforgettable adventure through the heart of Berlin's gastronomic scene. This immersive Berlin Center Food Tour will introduce you to over eight authentic local tastings. From the iconic currywurst and hearty pretzels to refreshing German beers and delectable pastries, you'll taste the true essence of Berlin. Led by a knowledgeable guide, you'll also explore the city's rich history and vibrant culture as you stroll through bustling markets and quaint, off-the-beaten-path eateries. This tour goes beyond food, offering a deep dive into Berlin's unique way of life, its people, and their traditions. Whether you're a food enthusiast or a curious traveler, this tour is a feast for all senses.
highlights: Guided tour of Berlin's food scene
Insight into Berlin's history and culture
Interaction with local vendors and artisans
tripAdvisorActivities.bestTimeToVisit: Year-round. However, spring and summer offer the chance to enjoy outdoor markets in pleasant weather.
whatToKnow: Wear comfortable shoes, as the tour involves a fair amount of walking.
Bring a water bottle to stay hydrated.
Always check with your guide about dietary restrictions.
Remember to bring cash for any extra purchases.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Guided Bike Tour of Amsterdam's Highlights and Hidden Gems
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Escape the tourist crowds and soak in the real charm of Amsterdam on this guided bike tour. Ride through the city's iconic canals, picturesque streets, and hidden paths that only locals know. Our experienced guides will take you on an unforgettable journey, sharing insider stories about Amsterdam's history, culture, and architecture. From the bustling Albert Cuyp Market to the tranquil Jordaan district, from the artistic vibe of the Museum Quarter to the vibrant nightlife in Leidseplein, this tour promises an eclectic mix of the city's highlights and hidden gems. You'll also enjoy a well-earned break in one of Amsterdam's beautiful parks, where you can relax and experience the city's laid-back lifestyle firsthand.
tripAdvisorActivities.bestTimeToVisit: Spring and Autumn seasons, weekdays from 10 AM to 4 PM.
whatToKnow: Comfortable clothing and shoes are recommended.
Helmets are provided but not mandatory.
Amsterdam is a bike-friendly city, but basic cycling skills are required.
The guide will adapt the pace to the group's abilities.

stops.title: Albert Cuyp Market
stops.description: Experience local culture in Amsterdam's largest street market.

stops.title: Museum Quarter
stops.description: Explore Amsterdam's artistic side in this vibrant district.

tripAdvisorActivities.cancellationPolicy: Free cancellation up to 24 hours before the tour starts.
accessibility: The route is flat and suitable for all fitness levels.
Bikes with child seats are available upon request.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Day Trip to Zaanse Schans, Edam, Volendam and Marken from Amsterdam
Absolutely Amsterdam - the Essential Introductory Walking Tour
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Discover the heart and soul of Amsterdam on this 'Absolutely Amsterdam' walking tour. Get ready to fall in love with the city's intertwining canals, historic houses, and vibrant street culture. Our expert guide will take you through the city's iconic landmarks, sharing intriguing stories and facts that bring Amsterdam's past and present to life. You'll discover hidden gems that only locals know about, from cozy cafes to quaint shops. This tour is the perfect introduction to Amsterdam, giving you a deeper understanding of the city's heritage and local life.
highlights: Explore the bustling Albert Cuyp Market
Enjoy Dutch snacks at a local eatery
tripAdvisorActivities.bestTimeToVisit: Spring and summer months, from April to August, are ideal. The tour starts at 10 am.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Anne Frank's Story - Guided Walking Tour through Amsterdam
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Embark on an emotional journey through Amsterdam as you trace the life of Anne Frank, one of the most renowned victims of the Holocaust. This guided walking tour will take you through the city's streets, unveiling the stark reality of WWII in Amsterdam. Our expert guide will narrate the poignant stories of Anne Frank's childhood, the hiding place she called the 'Secret Annex', and her brave yet heartrending diary. Experience a significant piece of world history as you stroll through the Jewish Quarter, visiting landmarks that marked Anne's short but stirring life. This is not just a tour, but a touching tribute to a young girl's spirit amidst atrocities.
highlights: Guided tour through Anne Frankâ€™s Amsterdam
Insightful stories about Anne Frank's life
Visit to the Secret Annex vicinity
Historical perspective of WWII in Amsterdam

Carry a raincoat/umbrella for unpredictable weather

tripAdvisorActivities.name: 10 Tastes of Amsterdam: Food Tour by UNESCO Canals and Jordaan
Amsterdam Food and Cultural Tour with Tastings
Zaanse Schans Windmills, Clogs and Dutch Cheese Small-Group Tour from Amsterdam
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Escape the bustling city of Amsterdam and delve into Dutch history at Zaanse Schans, a quaint, preserved 17th-century village that gives you a glimpse into the Netherlands' agricultural past. The tour will take you through the town's iconic windmills, providing you with picture-perfect views and a wealth of historical insight. Learn how the Dutch have been battling the sea to reclaim land for centuries and how windmills played a crucial role in this endeavor. Visit local craftsmen as they demonstrate the art of making Dutch clogs and cheese. Taste the world-renowned, locally produced Gouda and Edam, and take home a pair of traditional wooden shoes. This small-group tour promises an intimate, personalized experience, immersing you in the Dutch culture and its time-honored traditions.
tripAdvisorActivities.bestTimeToVisit: April to October, when the weather is generally pleasant and the village is in full bloom.
whatToKnow: Wear comfortable shoes for walking.
Bring a raincoat or umbrella in case of unpredictable weather.
Camera is a must for capturing the stunning views.
Book in advance to secure your spot.

stops.title: Windmill tour

stops.title: Clog-making workshop
stops.description: Watch a live demonstration by local artisans.

stops.title: Cheese tasting
stops.description: Savor the flavors of locally produced Dutch cheese.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Winner 2025 Florence Sunset Food & Wine Tour by Eating Europe
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Embark on an unforgettable gastronomic journey through the historic city of Florence, crowned as the winner of 2025 by Eating Europe. This sunset food & wine tour invites you to savour authentic Tuscan cuisine, sip on the finest local wines, and soak in the mesmerizing sights of the city as the sun sets. From bustling food markets to quaint trattorias, you'll discover the cityâ€™s culinary secrets and traditions, guided by an expert local foodie. As the crimson sun sets over the iconic skyline, the city comes alive in a whole new light. With each bite and sip, you'll delve deeper into Florence's rich culture and history, culminating in a truly unforgettable evening.
highlights: Guided tour by a local foodie
Exclusive access to popular food markets and trattorias

tripAdvisorActivities.name: The Best tour in Florence: Renaissance & Medici Tales - guided by a STORYTELLER
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Step back in time and experience the grandeur of the Renaissance on this guided tour in Florence, Italy. Guided by a professional storyteller, you will embark on a fascinating journey through the city's illustrious past, focusing on the influential Medici family and their profound impact on the world of art, politics, and culture. Stroll through the elegant streets, squares, and palaces that have preserved the city's rich history. Experience the captivating tales of the Medici family and gain a deeper understanding of the city's historical context. This tour offers a unique and interactive way to discover Florence, transforming the cityscape into a living history book.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: The Best Tour in Florence: Renaissance and Medici Tales
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Discover the secrets of the Renaissance and the captivating tales of the influential Medici family on this enriching tour in Florence. Weave through the labyrinthine streets of this historic city, visiting iconic landmarks and hidden gems alike. You'll marvel at the architectural splendor of Florence Cathedral, stand in awe of the grandeur of Palazzo Vecchio, and explore the vibrant San Lorenzo Market. Throughout the tour, our expert guide will bring history to life, recounting the stories of the Medici dynasty, their influence on Florence, and their pivotal role in the Renaissance. This isn't just a tour; it's a journey through time, filled with art, culture, and drama.
highlights: Guided tour of Florence's key sites
In-depth exploration of the Medici family's history
Visit to the vibrant San Lorenzo Market

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Florence Pizza or Pasta Class with Gelato Making at a Tuscan Farm
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Embark on a culinary journey through the heart of Italy with this immersive Pizza, Pasta and Gelato making class. Set in a picturesque Tuscan farm, this experience offers a unique blend of traditional cooking techniques and warm Italian hospitality. The class begins with a brief history of the dishes you'll be preparing, delivered by expert chefs who are as passionate about teaching as they are about Italian cuisine. Learn the secrets of kneading the perfect pizza dough, crafting fresh pasta, and churning creamy gelato. What's more, enjoy the fruits of your labor as you sit down to feast on your homemade Italian creations, complemented by local Tuscan wines. This is not merely a cooking class, but a delightful dive into the quintessential Italian 'La Dolce Vita'.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Tuscany Day Trip from Florence: Siena, San Gimignano, Pisa and Lunch at a Winery
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Embark on an unforgettable journey from Florence and discover the enchanting regions of Tuscany in a day. Visit Siena, a city bursting with rich history and Gothic architecture. Next, explore San Gimignano, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, famed for its medieval skyscrapers and panoramic views. Venture to Pisa and marvel at the iconic Leaning Tower. Lastly, savor the flavors of Tuscany with a savory lunch and wine tasting session at a local winery. This trip is an ideal blend of cultural exploration and gastronomical delight.
highlights: Explore the medieval city of Siena
Visit the UNESCO-listed town of San Gimignano
See the iconic Leaning Tower of Pisa
Indulge in a Tuscan lunch at a local winery

tripAdvisorActivities.name: From Rome to Tuscany: Discover Florence and Pisa in One Day
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Begin your journey in Rome and venture into the heart of Tuscany to visit two of Italy's most famous cities - Florence and Pisa. Travel through picturesque landscapes and immerse yourself in the rich culture and history that is embedded in every corner of these cities. In Florence, the birthplace of the Renaissance, marvel at the architectural masterpieces, and wander around the cobblestone streets filled with artisan shops and quaint cafes. In Pisa, get up close to the Leaning Tower, one of the world's greatest architectural wonders. This is a journey that promises a blend of art, history, and cuisine, ensuring a day full of unforgettable experiences.
highlights: Panoramic views of the Tuscan countryside
Florence's iconic Duomo and Ponte Vecchio

tripAdvisorActivities.name: SMALL-GROUP Wine Safaris: Tuscan Wine Tasting Tours from Florence
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Step into a world of lush vineyards, charming olive groves, and picturesque landscapes on a small-group Wine Safari in the Tuscan region from Florence. This unique adventure offers an intimate exploration of the most prestigious wine territories, where you'll discover Italy's renowned wines and their deeply rooted traditions. With a knowledgeable guide, you'll visit charming local wineries where you'll be introduced to the delicate art of winemaking and the secret behind the unique flavors of Tuscan wine. Enjoy generous tastings complemented by local delicacies like Tuscan cheese, salami, and homemade bruschetta. Experience the warmth and charm of Tuscan hospitality and return with unforgettable memories of the Italian countryside.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Florence Vespa Tour: Tuscan Hills and Italian Cuisine
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Zoom through Florence's iconic cobblestone streets and beyond, on a classic Vespa. Begin your journey in the heart of Florence, then venture into the dreamy Tuscan countryside, where undulating hills, vineyards, and olive groves create a mesmerising backdrop. Inhale the fresh scent of the countryside as you navigate the winding roads, stopping at panoramic viewpoints that offer sweeping views of Florence. After the ride, indulge in the flavours of Tuscany with a traditional Italian meal, complemented by local wines. Whether you're a seasoned rider or a Vespa novice, this tour is a unique way to explore Florence and savour the region's renowned cuisine.
highlights: Riding a Vespa through Tuscan hills

tripAdvisorActivities.name: E-Bikes Florence
tripAdvisorActivities.description: We provide everything you need for an unforgettable self guided and roadside assisted electric bike tour through the majestic Tuscan countryside surrounding Florence. With the freedom to explore at your own pace and boosted by our top quality e-bikes, you'll meander your way through cypress tree forests, olive groves and vineyards, little villages and hamlets with their ancient churches, monasteries, amphitheatres and delicious restaurants! You can sample the EV olive oils and locally produced wines, meet the owners of an organic Chianti vineyard and have the option to cool off in their outdoor swimming pool. Our route utilises the cycle path network to get you out onto the quieter country roads quickly and on the way back the cycle path route traverses the River Arno and up to Piazzale Michelangelo for great views of the city up close. The map works offline on your phone, we provide phone holders for the bikes and we are always on hand to make sure your ride goes smoothly.

photos.caption: Discover hidden gems of Tuscany that most tourists never see! Our premium e-bikes make exploring the Chianti wine region accessible and enjoyable for everyone. Stop among the vines, breathe in the countryside air, and capture unforgettable moments. We provide quality bikes, local expertise and roadside assistance so for you to create your own, unique Italian experience.
Cycle path along the river Arno at sundown

Escape the crowds on Tuscany's peaceful backroads! Our self-guided routes use quiet country lanes where ancient stone walls tell centuries of stories. These are the real roads of Chianti - where locals wave hello, where you might share the path with only a handful of other cyclists all day. Safe, scenic, and perfectly mapped on our GPS routes, these roads connect medieval villages and offer countless photo opportunities. The e-bikes handle the gentle grades with ease, letting you focus on the vi

Cycle the heart of Chianti wine country at your own pace! Our self-guided routes follow scenic paths between working vineyards where Sangiovese grapes ripen under the Tuscan sun. These quiet trails connect charming villages, family estates, and perfect picnic spots. Stop when you want, explore at your leisure, and use your bike's panniers to carry local treats from village shops. The gentle dirt paths and country roads offer authentic Tuscany - far from tourist crowds, close to nature, and absol

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Cooking Class and Lunch at a Tuscan Farmhouse with Local Market Tour from Florence
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Immerse yourself in the heart of the Tuscan countryside with a unique culinary adventure that will tantalize your taste buds and enrich your cultural knowledge. Your journey begins in Florence, where you'll embark on a tour of a local market. Rub shoulders with the locals, haggle over the freshest ingredients, and gain an in-depth understanding of Italian food culture. From there, you will travel to a charming Tuscan farmhouse. Amidst the olive groves and vineyards, you'll learn to prepare traditional Tuscan dishes under the guidance of an expert chef. Once your meal is prepared, sit down to savor the fruits of your labor, paired with local wines. This is more than just a cooking class; it's an unforgettable gastronomic journey into the heart of Tuscany.
highlights: Cooking Class at a Tuscan Farmhouse

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Alcazar and Cathedral of Seville Tour with Skip the Line Tickets
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Get ready to dive deep into the rich history of Seville with our immersive Alcazar and Cathedral tour. The Alcazar, one of the oldest palaces still in use today, is a stunning blend of architectural styles from the MudÃ©jar to the Gothic, and every corner whispers tales of monarchs past. The Cathedral, on the other hand, is one of the largest gothic cathedrals in the world, home to the awe-inspiring Giralda bell tower and the tomb of Christopher Columbus. In the company of our knowledgeable guide, you'll weave through the grand halls and tranquil courtyards of these iconic landmarks, gaining rare insights into their history and significance. And with our skip-the-line tickets, you'll bypass the queues and dive straight into the exploration.
highlights: Guided tour of the Alcazar and Cathedral
Visit to the Giralda bell tower

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Sevilla Food Tour: Tapas, Wine, History & Traditions
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Immerse yourself in the vibrant culture of Seville through its iconic food and wine scene on this guided Sevilla Food Tour. Offering a delightful mix of traditional tapas, local wines, and captivating history, this tour is a food lover's paradise. You will explore the lively streets of Seville, stopping at various local haunts to sample mouth-watering tapas and regional wines. Our knowledgeable guides will share the historical background of this beautiful city, its culinary traditions, and the secrets behind the delectable tapas and wine. Whether you are a foodie, a wine enthusiast, or a history buff, this tour will captivate your senses and leave you with unforgettable memories.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Plaza de Espana
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Step into the enchanting Plaza de EspaÃ±a, a breathtaking architectural marvel situated in the heart of Seville, Spain. Built for the Ibero-American Exposition of 1929, the plaza boasts a plethora of exquisite features, from the elaborate tile work to the stunning bridges reflecting in the semi-circular canal. Wander around the plaza to admire the 48 alcoves, each representing a Spanish province and adorned with beautiful ceramic tiles. The sense of tranquility is amplified by the picturesque canal where you can enjoy a leisurely boat ride. As the sun sets, the plaza illuminates, creating a magical ambiance that's simply unforgettable.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Seville
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Originally founded as a Roman city and now home to three UNESCO World Heritage Sites, Seville is bursting with antique charm.  The Alcazar palace complex is a stunning collage of architectural styles, and the Cathedral will impress you with its beauty and its status as the burial site of Christopher Columbus. The Metropol Parasol is the worldâ€™s largest wooden structure, a massive mix of grids and swirls that contains a market and a terrace observatory.
