tripAdvisorActivities.name: Tapas & Traditions of Seville Guided Food Tour
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Embark on a gastronomic journey through Seville's rich culinary landscape. Our Tapas & Traditions of Seville Guided Food Tour takes you through the winding streets of this Andalusian city to savor the best tapas and local dishes. You'll learn about Seville's food history, its traditional recipes, and the importance of tapas in Spanish culture. Visit bustling food markets, traditional tapas bars, and family-run establishments where you'll sample mouthwatering dishes, sip local wines and immerse yourself in the city's dynamic food scene. This tour isn't just about the food - it's a cultural adventure that provides insight into the heart of Seville's traditions.
highlights: Learn about Seville's food culture from a local guide

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Authentic Flamenco Show with Tapas & Wine Guided Tour
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Experience the spirit of Spain in Seville with an evening of traditional Flamenco, tapas, and wine. Begin your journey in the heart of the city where you'll be swept away by the powerful performances of professional Flamenco dancers, their fiery steps echoing the passionate soul of Spanish culture. As the music swells and the dancers move with hypnotic grace, you'll feel the raw emotion that makes Flamenco a UNESCO-protected art form. After the show, a local guide will lead you through the city's charming streets to a traditional tapas bar. Here, you'll indulge in an array of delicious small plates, each packed with bold flavors that reflect the region's culinary heritage. To compliment your meal, sample local wines, learn about their production, and discover why Spanish vintages have earned their place on the global stage.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Real Alcazar de Sevilla
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Beautiful medieval Islamic palace showcasing a unique fusion of Spanish Christian and Moorish architecture.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Spain Food Sherpas - Seville
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Slow food and tourism is something we support with all our heart, because itâ€™s the best way to really (and literally) savor everything a destination has to offer. Our experiences are in small groups, guided by enthusiastic food sherpas who believe that the local gastronomy is an essential part of the cityâ€™s history and its lifestyle. With us you will discover another side to Seville, learn where locals savour tasty tapas and drink wines, taste the most typical regional dishes in traditional bars. Wander orange tree-lined streets in the old town. Your Sherpa guides you through the city away from the main tourist areas.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Gascona
tripAdvisorActivities.description:
Experience the heart of Sevilleâ€™s food scene on Gascona Street, a buzzing hub of traditional tapas bars and cider houses. This charming street, dubbed the 'Boulevard of Cider', offers an authentic slice of Spanish life. Feast on scrumptious tapas as you wander amidst the lively crowds, soaking up the vibrant atmosphere. Step into traditional cider houses, where you'll witness the art of 'escanciado', a unique way of pouring cider to create the perfect fizz. As the sun sets, the street comes alive with locals and tourists alike, making it a perfect spot for a night out in Seville.

The beauty of Gascona is not just in its food and drink, but also in its character and charm. The vibrant murals, historical buildings, and friendly locals make this more than just a culinary experience - it's a cultural immersion. Whether you're a foodie, a cultural enthusiast, or simply looking for a memorable night out, Gascona is a must-visit.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Hotel Alfonso Xiii, A Luxury Collection Hotel, Seville
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Commissioned by the King of Spain to play host to international dignitaries during the 1929 Ibero-American Exhibition, Hotel Alfonso XIII, a Luxury Collection Hotel in Seville, remains an iconic cultural landmark. Located in the city center and the historic Santa Cruz quarter, right next to the Reales AlcÃ¡zares and Seville Cathedral, the 5-star Luxury Collection hotel in Seville features distinguished architecture and Moorish detailing. These elements have been enriched to showcase native Andalusian design and heritage to a new generation of travelers. The hotel's elegant dÃ©cor, from the lobby to the inner courtyard, reflects authentic Sevillian style. This ambience extends to our outdoor swimming pool and gardens, inviting guests to relax and refresh under the warm Andalusian sun. As one of the best hotels in Seville, we strive to ensure the most luxurious stays for our guests, whether for business or leisure.

Bangkok by Night: Temples, Markets and Food Tuk-Tuk Tour
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Uncover the magic of Bangkok by night on this thrilling Tuk-Tuk tour. As the city lights up, you'll snake through the bustling streets, taking in the vibrant atmosphere from your open-air ride. First, soak up the architectural beauty of illuminated temples like Wat Pho, a sight to behold under the night sky. Navigate the vibrant flower market, where you'll be captivated by the riot of colors and fragrances. Your tour culminates in a feast of local delicacies, from Pad Thai to Mango Sticky Rice, at a popular street food stand, offering a culinary conclusion to your night-time adventure.
tripAdvisorActivities.bestTimeToVisit: The tour is most enjoyable in the cool, dry season between November and February.

Bring a light jacket for cooler evenings.
The tour is not recommended for individuals with mobility issues.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Bangkok Backstreets Food Tour with 15+ Tastings
tripAdvisorActivities.description: Embark on an unforgettable gastronomic journey through the bustling backstreets of Bangkok. This immersive food tour takes you off the beaten path to savor the cityâ€™s authentic flavors and culinary gems tucked away in hidden alleyways. With over 15 tastings included, your taste buds are in for a treat. From mouth-watering street food to local specialties, each dish tells a story of the cityâ€™s rich cultural tapestry. Guided by a knowledgeable local, you'll also learn about the city's history and food traditions. This tour is not just about eating; it's a cultural and sensory journey that no food lover should miss!
tripAdvisorActivities.bestTimeToVisit: The tour operates year-round. However, the best time to visit is during the cooler months, from November to February.
whatToKnow: Wear comfortable shoes for walking.

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Hidden Bangkok Longtail Boat Tour to Big Buddha&Canal Life 2hrs

description: Bangkok, the bustling capital of Thailand, offers a unique blend of modernity and tradition that is sure to captivate every traveler. Begin your journey in the heart of the city where towering skyscrapers stand alongside centuries-old temples, creating a stunning visual contrast. Explore the vibrant street markets, where the air is filled with the tempting aromas of Thai street food, and the colorful stalls overflow with everything from exotic fruits to intricate handicrafts. Venture into the tranquil sanctuaries of the city's famous temples such as Wat Arun and Wat Phra Kaew, where you can observe monks in prayer and marvel at the intricate religious art. As the sun sets, Bangkok transforms into a lively entertainment hub, with bustling night markets, rooftop bars, and world-class restaurants. No trip to Bangkok is complete without a ride in a traditional long-tail boat, cruising along the Chao Phraya River and the city's network of canals, offering a unique perspective of life in the 'Venice of the East'.

tripAdvisorActivities.description: Experience a unique blend of cultural diversity and history in Kuala Lumpur, starting with an awe-inspiring visit to the Batu Caves, a Hindu temple and shrine set within a massive limestone hill. Climb 272 steps to reach the main cave, where you'll marvel at the towering golden statue of Hindu deity Lord Murugan and stunning cave formations. After exploring, you'll proceed to other cultural attractions in Kuala Lumpur. Visit the cityâ€™s bustling markets and neighborhoods that showcase the city's multicultural heritage. Savor the tantalizing flavors of local cuisine and feel the pulse of the city in its bustling streets. This tour is an intimate discovery of what makes Kuala Lumpur a vibrant multicultural hub of heritage, food, and culture.
highlights: Private guided tour for personalized experience
tripAdvisorActivities.bestTimeToVisit: Early morning or late afternoon during weekdays to avoid crowds. Cooler months of December to February offer pleasant weather.
whatToKnow: Wear comfortable shoes for the climb
Modest dressing is required for temple visit
Batu Caves has many monkeys; keep food and shiny objects hidden
Street food vendors may not accept credit cards

tripAdvisorActivities.name: Sambal Streets Kuala Lumpur Food Tour with 15+ Tastings
tripAdvisorActivities.description:
The Sambal Streets Kuala Lumpur Food Tour is a must-do for every foodie. This tour takes you through the vibrant streets of this dynamic city, introducing you to the diverse and delicious Malaysian cuisine. From sizzling satays to mouth-watering rendang, enjoy over 15 tastings at various local hotspots. Along the way, learn about the city's rich history and culture from your knowledgeable guide. You'll also have the chance to mingle with the locals, adding an authentic touch to your culinary journey.

The tour is not just about food, but also about exploration. As you walk through the bustling streets, you'll experience the city's energetic atmosphere and witness the daily life of its inhabitants. Whether you're a first-time visitor or a seasoned traveler, the Sambal Streets Food Tour offers a unique perspective on Kuala Lumpur, making it an unforgettable experience.
highlights: Learn about local culture and history
tripAdvisorActivities.bestTimeToVisit: The food tour operates all year round. However, evenings are the best time to explore the food scene when the streets come alive with food stalls and locals.
whatToKnow: Wear comfortable shoes as there will be a lot of walking
Bring an empty stomach
The tour is not suitable for those with dietary restrictions
The food stalls accept cash only

description: Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia's lively capital city, is a vibrant blend of old and new. Here, towering skyscrapers coexist with colonial buildings, and lush parks provide a respite from the city's bustling streets. Start your day at the Petronas Twin Towers, the city's iconic landmark. From the Skybridge, take in breathtaking views of the metropolis below. Explore the city's heritage in the bustling streets of Chinatown and the colorful Batu Caves, a Hindu temple set in a massive limestone hill. End your day at Jalan Alor, a food street offering a delectable array of local cuisine. Kuala Lumpur is a city that never sleeps, offering an unforgettable adventure for every traveler.
